p: The glutton thistle is a perennial herbaceous plant with a voluminous, sweeping, fleshy rhizome 30 to 40 centimeters long. It has deeply cut leaves in spiky lobes grouped in a rosette. The pink flowers are grouped in capitula surrounded by bracts bristling with spines. After fruiting, a yellowish white latex exudes in the armpit of bracts [ 8]. The fruit is achene hairy, ellipsoidal, and surmounted by a white egret [ 9].
